NeighborhoodNotes: Fast-growing neighborhood with new luxury condos, waterfront parks, and easy Manhattan access via 7/E/M trains. Popular with young professionals. Strong rental market. Slightly softening prices post-COVID.

Vibrant Midtown West neighborhood with excellent dining, nightlife, and transit access (A/C/E/1/2/3). Mix of new and older condos. Near Times Square and Hudson River Park. Strong for both owner-occupants and investors.

Down Under the Manhattan Bridge Overpass - trendy waterfront neighborhood with cobblestone streets, art galleries, tech companies. Mix of converted lofts and new luxury condos. Brooklyn Bridge Park access. Premium pricing but slower sales recently.

Historic financial center transforming into residential neighborhood. Many glass high-rises with amenities. Excellent for young finance professionals. Weekends can be quiet. Rent-to-price ratios slightly below Manhattan average.

Classic NYC neighborhood with prewar buildings, tree-lined streets, cultural institutions (Lincoln Center, museums). Family-friendly with excellent schools. Central Park access. Stable market with affluent buyer base. Higher HOA fees typical for older buildings.

Brownstone Brooklyn at its finest - family-oriented, tree-lined streets, Prospect Park access, great schools and restaurants. Mix of condos in converted brownstones and newer buildings. Strong demand from families. Prices holding steady.
